meanings.definition: A group of symptoms that consistently occur together and characterize a particular condition.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed her with a rare syndrome that caused extreme fatigue and joint pain.
meanings.sent2: The chronic fatigue syndrome made it difficult for him to focus on his work.
meanings.sent3: His obsession with organizing his books by color could be called a 'color-coding syndrome.'
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, her unique style became a syndrome that others tried to imitate.
meanings.sent5: The syndrome of forgetfulness plagued him, causing him to misplace his keys daily.

meanings.definition: A characteristic combination of opinions, emotions, or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her syndrome of always seeing the positive side of things was contagious.
meanings.sent2: The syndrome of fear and anxiety overwhelmed him in social situations.
meanings.sent3: His syndrome of always needing to have the last word in an argument was both frustrating and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The syndrome of laughter spreading through the room was a welcome relief after a tense meeting.
meanings.sent5: The syndrome of kindness and generosity in the community made it a wonderful place to live.
